thread.title: Plan your Halloween with these spooktacular events
thread.title_full: Plan your Halloween with these spooktacular events

title: Plan your Halloween with these spooktacular events
text:
Plan your Halloween with these spooktacular events Plan your Halloween with these spooktacular events Looking for something scary to do this weekend? Sponsored by Milton Whispering Pines Christmas Tree Farm Haunted Hayrides, Bonfires, Concerts When : Tagging starts Oct. 1; Haunted hayride runs Oct. 16, 17, 18, 23, 24, 25, 30 and 31. Where : Whispering Pines Christmas Tree Farm, 1603 Penton Road, Milton, Fl. Details : Haunted Hayride includes scares and frights through the woods, with a separate hayride to paintball shoot zombies; tag a live Christmas tree and return after Thanksgiving to cut it down. Cost : Haunted Hayride and paintball hayride are $10 each, with those four and younger admitted for free. Tree tagging is free, with trees costing $4 per foot when customers return to cut them down. Downtown Pensacola 25th annual Haunted House Walking and Trolley Tours When : Fridays and Saturdays through Oct. 30. Tragedy and Terror Pedal Trolley will take place on Oct. 24 only. Where : Voices of Pensacola Multicultural Center, 117 E. Government St. Details : Get your ghoul on one of four walking tour routes, including the Ghastly Ghosts of North Seville Walking Tour, Murder and Mayhem Walking Tour, Redlight Walking Tour or the Tragedy and Terror Walking Tour. If you prefer to cruise along the ghosts of North Hill try the Trolley of the Doomed. Cost : Walking Tour: $15 adults ' $8 for children 12 and younger. Trolley Tour: $20 adults ' $10 for children 12 and younger. Pedal Trolley: $45. Boo at the Zoo: Trick or Treat Trail When : 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays through Oct. 25. Where : Gulf Breeze Zoo, 5701 Gulf Breeze Parkway, Gulf Breeze. Details : Children are invited to don their costumes and enjoy the zoo decked out for the Halloween holiday in a not-so-scary environment. The event features bounce houses, animal encounters and face painting. There will be a trick or treat trail featuring stations for children to enjoy toys, treats and treasures. Cost: $12 adults ' $12 children ' under 2 FREE ' $6 season pass holders. Milton 15th Annual Ghost Walk Downtown Milton When : Tours start at 6 p.m. with the last to start at 9 p.m. Oct. 18 - Oct. 25. Where : 6866 Caroline Street, Milton, Fl. Details : This year's theme is "Celebrating 100 Years of Milton High School." Cost : $10 adults ' $5 children (under 5 and/or in a stroller free) ' VIP Cut the Line tickets $20 adults ' $10 children. 6th Annual Halloween Egg Haunt When : 5:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24. Where : Roger Scott Athletic Complex, 2130 Summit Blvd, Pensacola. Details : There will be five egg haunts for children who are stroller age up to 13 years, a kids carnival, PNJ Costume Contest and photo booth, Haunted Hayride, Spooky Nature Trail, and bounce houses. Cost : Admission is free, but ask those who can to bring a donation of a non-perishable food tiem to the onsite MANNA food-drive. When : 7 p.m. to midnight Fridays and Saturdays through Oct. 31. Where : Milton Train Depot, 4850 Henry St., Milton. Details : Haunted Woods: Deadly Games is a Halloween-themed event which serves as a fundraiser for the West Florida Railroad Museum. Cost : Tickets: $15 presale; $20 general admission. The Fright Pass ($30) allows front of the line access. The RIP Pass ($50) includes front of the line access, a Haunted Woods T-shirt, and Haunted woods bracelet. When : 6:30 p.m. Oct. 16, Oct. 23 - 24, Oct. 30 - 31. Where : Pensacola Lighthouse and Museum, 2081 Radford Blvd Pensacola, FL. Details : A fun, friendly and frightful event for the entire family, based on a traditional haunted house. Wear your costumes! Tower will be open, please wear appropriate clothes/shoes under your costume for climbing safety. No reservations. Cost : $7 adults ' $4 children. When : 6 p.m. Oct. 17. Where : Pensacola Lighthouse and Museum, 2081 Radford Blvd Pensacola, FL. Details : Dinner and dancing under the stars! There will be a costume contest and prizes as well as private haunted lighthouse tour. Come climb to the top for a chance encounter with a past keeper and enjoy the most breathtaking view of a moonlit Pensacola Bay. Reservations are limited. Cost : $50 per person A store built in 1906 is one of The Purgatorium's many props. Courtesy of The Purgatorium Pensacola The Purgatorium: Haunted Attraction and Festival of Doom When : 7 p.m. - 11 p.m. Oct. 23, 24, 29, 30, 31. Where : 6615 W. Jackson St., Pensacola. Details : The Purgatorium Haunted Attraction and Festival of Doom is an outdoor Haunted walk-thru situated on 2 acres of land. It has an alien area, autopsy area, large graveyard, zombies, clowns and all creatures in between, a full-scale car wreck scene, a BlackOut ScreamOut area, a ton of twists and turns and something we call a "Friendship Destroyer". Hip Pocket will be there as a vendor food truck (except on Halloween night). Cost : Regular tickers: $5 per person ' $20 per person all 5 nights. VIP tickets: $8 per person ' $28 per person all 5 nights. Christopher B Girod, Pensacola News Journal 12:47 p.m. CDT October 16, 2015 Haunted couple. 42 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Have you ever tried putting together a list of everything Halloween related around here? It's hard work. That's why we've done it for you. Here's everything going on this Halloween. 
Mobile Users: WHISPERING PINES CHRISTMAS TREE FARM HAUNTED HAYRIDES, BONFIRES, CONCERTS 
When : Tagging starts Oct. 1; Haunted hayride runs Oct. 16, 17, 18, 23, 24, 25, 30 and 31. 
Where : Whispering Pines Christmas Tree Farm, 1603 Penton Road, Milton, Fl. 
Details : Haunted Hayride includes scares and frights through the woods, with a separate hayride to paintball shoot zombies; tag a live Christmas tree and return after Thanksgiving to cut it down. 
Cost : Haunted Hayride and paintball hayride are $10 each, with those four and younger admitted for free. Tree tagging is free, with trees costing $4 per foot when customers return to cut them down. 25TH ANNUAL HAUNTED HOUSE WALKING AND TROLLEY TOURS 
25th annual haunted house walking and trolley tours (Photo: Special to the News Journal) 
When : Fridays and Saturdays through Oct. 30. Tragedy and Terror Pedal Trolley will take place on Oct. 24 only. 
Where : Voices of Pensacola Multicultural Center, 117 E. Government St. 
Details : Get your ghoul on one of four walking tour routes, including the Ghastly Ghosts of North Seville Walking Tour, Murder and Mayhem Walking Tour, Redlight Walking Tour or the Tragedy and Terror Walking Tour. If you prefer to cruise along the ghosts of North Hill try the Trolley of the Doomed. 
Cost : Walking Tour: $15 adults | $8 for children 12 and younger. Trolley Tour: $20 adults | $10 for children 12 and younger. Pedal Trolley: $45. 
www.historicpensacola.org BOO AT THE ZOO: TRICK OR TREAT TRAIL 
Breanna Hensley, 4, is dressed a Robin, and Bailey Hensley, 4, is dressed as Batman, so they can torment their big brother, Logan Hensley, 7, who is dressed as the Joker, while they explored last year?s Boo at the Zoo entertainment with Ashton LaBerge, 6, dressed as Iron Man. (Photo: Bruce Graner/bgraner @pnj.com, Bruce Graner/bgraner@pnj.com) 
When : 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays through Oct. 25. 
Where : Gulf Breeze Zoo, 5701 Gulf Breeze Parkway, Gulf Breeze. 
Details : Children are invited to don their costumes and enjoy the zoo decked out for the Halloween holiday in a not-so-scary environment. The event features bounce houses, animal encounters and face painting. There will be a trick or treat trail featuring stations for children to enjoy toys, treats and treasures. 
Cost : $12 adults | $12 children | under 2 FREE | $6 season pass holders. 
www.gulfbreezezoo.org 15TH ANNUAL GHOST WALK DOWNTOWN MILTON 
L-R: Angela Nolan (as a 1940's news reporter) Mitch Riley (as Millard Caldwell- 29th Florida Gov.) Linda Henderson (as Bernice Parker- WWII draft agent) and Wes Meiss (as Sheriff John Harvell) are characters from the Ghost Walk in Milton. (Photo: Gary McCracken/gmccracken@pnj.co, Gary McCracken/gmccracken@pnj.co) 
When : Tours start at 6 p.m. with the last to start at 9 p.m. Oct. 18 - Oct. 25. 
Where : 6866 Caroline Street, Milton, Fl. 
Details : This year's theme is "Celebrating 100 Years of Milton High School." 
Cost : $10 adults | $5 children (under 5 and/or in a stroller free) | VIP Cut the Line tickets $20 adults | $10 children. 
www.santarosahistoricalsociety.com 6TH ANNUAL HALLOWEEN EGG HAUNT 
Martha Stewart Living The Easter tradition of decorating eggs in pretty pastels has morphed into spooky or playful takes for Halloween. In this image released by Martha Stewart Living shows eggs decorated in a Halloween theme. The blending of holiday traditions _ think Hanukkah bush _ now kicks off with Halloween in a variety of ways. The Easter tradition of decorating eggs in pretty pastels has morphed into spooky or playful takes for Halloween. (Photo: Victor Schrager, AP) 
When : 5:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24. 
Where : Roger Scott Athletic Complex, 2130 Summit Blvd, Pensacola. 
Details : There will be five egg haunts for children who are stroller age up to 13 years, a kids carnival, PNJ Costume Contest and photo booth, Haunted Hayride, Spooky Nature Trail, and bounce houses. 
Cost : Admission is free, but ask those who can to bring a donation of a non-perishable food tiem to the onsite MANNA food-drive.
